00:00:05:168000.Scene: The apartment. A robotic arm is extracting some Chinese takeaway from a bag controlled by Howard.
00:00:05:168000.Speaker: Howard
00:00:05:168000.Dialogue: And now the kung pao chicken.

00:00:07:270000.Scene: The apartment. A robotic arm is extracting some Chinese takeaway from a bag controlled by Howard.
00:00:07:270000.Speaker: Leonard

00:00:08:654000.Scene: The apartment. A robotic arm is extracting some Chinese takeaway from a bag controlled by Howard.
00:00:08:654000.Speaker: Raj

00:00:10:073000.Scene: The apartment. A robotic arm is extracting some Chinese takeaway from a bag controlled by Howard.
00:00:10:073000.Speaker: Howard
00:00:10:073000.Dialogue: And finally, my moo shu pork.

00:00:15:595000.Scene: The apartment. A robotic arm is extracting some Chinese takeaway from a bag controlled by Howard.
00:00:15:595000.Speaker: Raj

00:00:16:880000.Scene: The apartment. A robotic arm is extracting some Chinese takeaway from a bag controlled by Howard.
00:00:16:880000.Speaker: Howard
00:00:16:880000.Dialogue: Are you telling me, for the past four months I have been asking you, What's new? and you never thought to go with, "Sheldon has a girlfriend"?

00:00:22:802000.Scene: The apartment. A robotic arm is extracting some Chinese takeaway from a bag controlled by Howard.
00:00:22:802000.Speaker: Raj

00:00:26:139000.Scene: The apartment. A robotic arm is extracting some Chinese takeaway from a bag controlled by Howard.
00:00:26:139000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:00:26:139000.Dialogue: Impressive, but we must be cautious.

00:00:27:290000.Scene: The apartment. A robotic arm is extracting some Chinese takeaway from a bag controlled by Howard.
00:00:27:290000.Speaker: Howard

00:00:29:659000.Scene: The apartment. A robotic arm is extracting some Chinese takeaway from a bag controlled by Howard.
00:00:29:659000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:00:29:659000.Dialogue: Today, it's a Chinese food retrieval robot. Tomorrow, it travels back in time and tries to kill Sarah Connor.

00:00:37:683000.Scene: The apartment. A robotic arm is extracting some Chinese takeaway from a bag controlled by Howard.
00:00:37:683000.Speaker: Leonard
00:00:37:683000.Dialogue: I don't think that's going to happen, Sheldon.

00:00:39:986000.Scene: The apartment. A robotic arm is extracting some Chinese takeaway from a bag controlled by Howard.
00:00:39:986000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:00:39:986000.Dialogue: No one ever does. That's why it happens.

00:00:43:990000.Scene: The apartment. A robotic arm is extracting some Chinese takeaway from a bag controlled by Howard.
00:00:43:990000.Speaker: Penny
00:00:43:990000.Dialogue: Hey. Is the food here? Ooh. What's that?

00:00:47:010000.Scene: The apartment. A robotic arm is extracting some Chinese takeaway from a bag controlled by Howard.
00:00:47:010000.Speaker: Howard
00:00:47:010000.Dialogue: That, dear lady, is the Wolowitz Programmable Hand, designed for extravehicular repairs on the International Space Station.

00:00:55:051000.Scene: The apartment. A robotic arm is extracting some Chinese takeaway from a bag controlled by Howard.
00:00:55:051000.Speaker: Penny

00:00:56:636000.Scene: The apartment. A robotic arm is extracting some Chinese takeaway from a bag controlled by Howard.
00:00:56:636000.Speaker: Howard
00:00:56:636000.Dialogue: Ask me to pass the soy sauce.

00:00:58:338000.Scene: The apartment. A robotic arm is extracting some Chinese takeaway from a bag controlled by Howard.
00:00:58:338000.Speaker: Penny
00:00:58:338000.Dialogue: Oh, does that come up much on the space station?

00:01:01:107000.Scene: The apartment. A robotic arm is extracting some Chinese takeaway from a bag controlled by Howard.
00:01:01:107000.Speaker: Howard
00:01:01:107000.Dialogue: Mostly with Asian and Jewish astronauts.

00:01:04:544000.Scene: The apartment. A robotic arm is extracting some Chinese takeaway from a bag controlled by Howard.
00:01:04:544000.Speaker: Penny
00:01:04:544000.Dialogue: All right. Pass the soy sauce.

00:01:18:324000.Scene: The apartment. A robotic arm is extracting some Chinese takeaway from a bag controlled by Howard.
00:01:18:324000.Speaker: Leonard

00:01:19:394000.Scene: The apartment. A robotic arm is extracting some Chinese takeaway from a bag controlled by Howard.
00:01:19:394000.Speaker: Penny
00:01:19:394000.Dialogue: Oh, it's not bad. Kind of hungry.

00:01:22:946000.Scene: The apartment. A robotic arm is extracting some Chinese takeaway from a bag controlled by Howard.
00:01:22:946000.Speaker: Leonard

00:01:24:781000.Scene: The apartment. A robotic arm is extracting some Chinese takeaway from a bag controlled by Howard.
00:01:24:781000.Speaker: Howard

00:01:26:583000.Scene: The apartment. A robotic arm is extracting some Chinese takeaway from a bag controlled by Howard.
00:01:26:583000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:01:26:583000.Dialogue: You realize, Penny,that the technology that went into this arm will one day make unskilled food servers such as yourself obsolete.

00:01:33:907000.Scene: The apartment. A robotic arm is extracting some Chinese takeaway from a bag controlled by Howard.
00:01:33:907000.Speaker: Penny
00:01:33:907000.Dialogue: Really? They're going to make a robotthat spits on your hamburger?

00:01:39:529000.Scene: The apartment. A robotic arm is extracting some Chinese takeaway from a bag controlled by Howard.
00:01:39:529000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:01:39:529000.Dialogue: I thought you broke up with her. Why is she here?

00:01:43:783000.Scene: The apartment. A robotic arm is extracting some Chinese takeaway from a bag controlled by Howard.
00:01:43:783000.Speaker: Howard
00:01:43:783000.Dialogue: Okay, here we go. Passing the soy sauce. Put out your hand.

00:01:53:776000.Scene: The apartment. A robotic arm is extracting some Chinese takeaway from a bag controlled by Howard.
00:01:53:776000.Speaker: Penny

00:01:57:830000.Scene: The apartment. A robotic arm is extracting some Chinese takeaway from a bag controlled by Howard.
00:01:57:830000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:01:57:830000.Dialogue: I wouldn't say amazing. At best, it's a modest leap forward from the basic technology that gave us Country Bear Jamboree.

00:02:06:489000.Scene: The apartment. A robotic arm is extracting some Chinese takeaway from a bag controlled by Howard.
00:02:06:489000.Speaker: Howard

00:02:07:957000.Scene: The apartment. A robotic arm is extracting some Chinese takeaway from a bag controlled by Howard.
00:02:07:957000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:02:15:999000.Scene: The apartment. A robotic arm is extracting some Chinese takeaway from a bag controlled by Howard.
00:02:15:999000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:02:17:967000.Scene: The apartment. A robotic arm is extracting some Chinese takeaway from a bag controlled by Howard.
00:02:17:967000.Speaker: Howard

00:02:47:349000.Speaker: Penny
00:02:47:349000.Dialogue: Does NASA know you're using that thing as a napkin holder?

00:02:50:819000.Speaker: Howard
00:02:50:819000.Dialogue: You kidding? They still think it's in a secure locker at JPL.

00:02:56:725000.Speaker: Howard
00:02:56:725000.Dialogue: Borrowed. The trick is to carry it out to your car like you own it.

00:03:02:314000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:03:02:314000.Dialogue: Excuse me. Oh. Amy's at the dry cleaners, and she's made a very amusing pun. "I don't care for perchloroethylene, and I don't like glycol ether."

00:03:22:568000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:03:22:568000.Dialogue: Get it? She doesn't like glycol ether.

00:03:40:035000.Speaker: Penny
00:03:40:035000.Dialogue: Sheldon has a girlfriend?, She's not my girlfriend.

00:03:42:120000.Speaker: Penny
00:03:42:120000.Dialogue: How long How long has this been going on?

00:03:52:447000.Speaker: Penny
00:03:52:447000.Dialogue: Ah... d-d-d-d... How did they meet?

00:03:55:250000.Speaker: Howard
00:03:55:250000.Dialogue: Raj and I entered Sheldon's information on a dating site, and it spit out Amy Farrah Fowler.

00:03:59:871000.Speaker: Penny
00:03:59:871000.Dialogue: Oh, my God! Sheldon and Amy.

00:04:05:811000.Speaker: Penny
00:04:05:811000.Dialogue: Shamy. I am so digging the Shamy.

00:04:09:231000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:04:09:231000.Dialogue: All right, everyone pay attention. Yes, I have a friend named Amy Farrah Fowler. Yes, she is female. Yes, we communicate on a daily basis, but no, she is not my girlfriend.

00:04:20:242000.Speaker: Penny
00:04:20:242000.Dialogue: Okay, well, what do you communicate about?

00:04:22:728000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:04:22:728000.Dialogue: Well, my work in physics,her work in neurobiology, and most recently, the possibility of our having a child together.

00:04:41:179000.Speaker: Leonard
00:04:41:179000.Dialogue: Wait a minute-- a child? You never see this girl. You just e-mail and text and Twitter. Now you're considering having a baby?

00:04:47:919000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:04:47:919000.Dialogue: Amy pointed out that between the two of us, our genetic material has the potential of producing the first in a line of intellectually superior, benign overlords to guide humanity to a brighter tomorrow.

00:05:02:134000.Speaker: Howard
00:05:02:134000.Dialogue: I'm guessing that future historians will condemn us for not taking this opportunity to kill Sheldon.

00:05:12:494000.Speaker: Penny
00:05:12:494000.Dialogue: You don't even like people touching you. How are you going to have sex?

00:05:17:716000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:05:17:716000.Dialogue: Why on Earth would we have sex?

00:05:21:887000.Speaker: Penny
00:05:21:887000.Dialogue: Oh, honey, did your mom not have the talk with you? You know, when your private parts started growing?

00:05:28:176000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:05:28:176000.Dialogue: I'm quite aware of the way humans usually reproduce, which is messy, unsanitary, and based on living next to you for three years, involves loud and unnecessary appeals to a deity.

00:05:45:110000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:05:45:110000.Dialogue: Consequently, if Amy and I choose to bring new life into this world, it will be accomplished clinically, with fertility experts in a lab with petri dishes. Which reminds me-- you have broad hips and a certain corn-fed vigor. Is your womb available for rental?

00:06:06:014000.Speaker: Penny
00:06:06:014000.Dialogue: Look, Sheldon, before you race off to the fertility clinic, you might want to think about- uh, gee, I don't know-- maybe actually spending some time with her.

00:06:20:362000.Speaker: Penny
00:06:20:362000.Dialogue: Okay, look, don't think of it as dating a girlfriend. Think of it as, uh... getting to know the future mother of your child.

00:06:26:418000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:06:26:418000.Dialogue: Oh. I hadn't considered that. I suppose she will have to have access to our progeny. And you don't think I can achieve the required intimacy via text messaging?

00:06:39:164000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:06:39:164000.Dialogue: Huh. It would appear as if the phone companies have been lying to me.

00:06:52:594000.Speaker: Penny
00:06:52:594000.Dialogue: You do realize I stand on the other side of the door waiting for you to finish knocking three times.

00:06:58:183000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:06:58:183000.Dialogue: I know. I can see the shadow of your feet under the door.

00:07:01:520000.Speaker: Penny
00:07:01:520000.Dialogue: Yeah, my point is it's a waste of time.

00:07:04:473000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:07:04:473000.Dialogue: If you're looking for an example of a waste of time, I would refer you to the conversation we're having right now.

00:07:11:329000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:07:11:329000.Dialogue: I've decided to take your advice and have arranged to go on a date with Amy Farrah Fowler.

00:07:16:735000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:07:16:735000.Dialogue: (stammers) Wait. You have to drive me.

00:07:30:716000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:07:30:716000.Dialogue: Actually, I'm paraphrasing. Having been raised in a Christian household, I'm uncomfortable with the language he used. And to be honest, I'm not entirely comfortable with "cockamamy."

00:07:44:946000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:07:44:946000.Dialogue: Hurry. We're going to be late.

00:07:47:866000.Speaker: Penny
00:07:47:866000.Dialogue: Sheldon, did it ever occur to you that I might have other plans?

00:07:51:653000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:07:51:653000.Dialogue: I'm sorry. Do you have other plans?

00:07:57:325000.Speaker: Penny
00:07:57:325000.Dialogue: Well, no, not per se, but...

00:08:00:362000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:08:00:362000.Dialogue: So this conversation is as pointless as your door-knocking soliloquy?

00:08:07:135000.Speaker: Penny
00:08:07:135000.Dialogue: Let me get my... cockamamy keys.

00:08:12:758000.Scene: Howard’s bedroom. Howard is being massaged by the robot hand.
00:08:12:758000.Speaker: Howard
00:08:12:758000.Dialogue: WOLOWITZ: Oh, God, that feels so good.

00:08:20:131000.Scene: Howard’s bedroom. Howard is being massaged by the robot hand.
00:08:20:131000.Speaker: Howard
00:08:20:131000.Dialogue: Yeah, that's the spot. Oh, baby.

00:08:23:735000.Scene: Howard’s bedroom. Howard is being massaged by the robot hand.
00:08:23:735000.Speaker: Mrs Wolowitz

00:08:27:105000.Scene: Howard’s bedroom. Howard is being massaged by the robot hand.
00:08:27:105000.Speaker: Howard
00:08:27:105000.Dialogue: I'll eat later. I'm busy! Oh, yeah. Just like a real hand.

00:08:41:837000.Scene: Howard’s bedroom. Howard is being massaged by the robot hand.
00:08:41:837000.Speaker: Howard

00:08:51:663000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:08:51:663000.Dialogue: I wish you weren't wearing flip-flops. It's dangerous to drive in flip-flops.

00:09:03:575000.Speaker: Penny
00:09:03:575000.Dialogue: Can I ask you a question?

00:09:05:894000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:09:05:894000.Dialogue: Given your community college education, I encourage you to ask me as many as possible.

00:09:12:951000.Speaker: Penny
00:09:12:951000.Dialogue: Yeah. (clears throat) Well, my question is-- and I'm pretty sure I know the answer-- is this your first date?

00:09:19:524000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:09:19:524000.Dialogue: That depends. Does square-dancing with my sister at a Teens for Jesus Fourth of July Hoedown count as a date?

00:09:29:167000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:09:29:167000.Dialogue: Then, this is my first date.

00:09:32:554000.Speaker: Penny
00:09:32:554000.Dialogue: Okay. Well, then, there's a couple of things you should probably know.

00:09:35:607000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:09:35:607000.Dialogue: I have a master's degree and two doctorates. The things I should know, I do know.

00:09:42:764000.Speaker: Penny
00:09:42:764000.Dialogue: My point is, I know more about dating than you, and if you were as smart as you think you are, you would listen to me.

00:09:49:771000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:09:49:771000.Dialogue: If you know so much, how come I have a date tonight and you have nothing better to do than drive me to it?

00:10:04:119000.Speaker: Raj
00:10:04:119000.Dialogue: You know, there's something I've always wondered about Aquaman.

00:10:13:478000.Speaker: Raj
00:10:13:478000.Dialogue: What would a toilet look like in Atlantis? How would you flush it? And when you did flush it, where would the poop go?

00:10:27:192000.Speaker: Leonard
00:10:27:192000.Dialogue: Hey, Howard. What's going on? What... Hold on. Howard, Howard, slow down. The robot hand is stuck on your what?

00:10:39:454000.Scene: Penny’s car. Amy is now in the back seat.
00:10:39:454000.Speaker: Leonard
00:10:39:454000.Dialogue: You're not going to believe this.

00:10:55:971000.Scene: Penny’s car. Amy is now in the back seat.
00:10:55:971000.Speaker: Penny
00:10:55:971000.Dialogue: So, um, Amy, Sheldon tells me you're a neuro... something-or-other.

00:11:01:760000.Scene: Penny’s car. Amy is now in the back seat.
00:11:01:760000.Speaker: Amy
00:11:01:760000.Dialogue: Neurobiologist. Your "check engine" light is on.

00:11:08:701000.Scene: Penny’s car. Amy is now in the back seat.
00:11:08:701000.Speaker: Penny

00:11:09:935000.Scene: Penny’s car. Amy is now in the back seat.
00:11:09:935000.Speaker: Amy

00:11:10:953000.Scene: Penny’s car. Amy is now in the back seat.
00:11:10:953000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:11:10:953000.Dialogue: Don't bother. I've wasted many an hour tilting at that particular windmill.

00:11:19:078000.Scene: Penny’s car. Amy is now in the back seat.
00:11:19:078000.Speaker: Penny
00:11:19:078000.Dialogue: Uh, what is that scent you're wearing? It smells great.

00:11:21:714000.Scene: Penny’s car. Amy is now in the back seat.
00:11:21:714000.Speaker: Amy

00:11:25:634000.Scene: Penny’s car. Amy is now in the back seat.
00:11:25:634000.Speaker: Amy

00:11:28:087000.Scene: Penny’s car. Amy is now in the back seat.
00:11:28:087000.Speaker: Penny
00:11:28:087000.Dialogue: Ah. Well, your hair looks very nice.

00:11:31:340000.Scene: Penny’s car. Amy is now in the back seat.
00:11:31:340000.Speaker: Amy

00:11:35:127000.Scene: Penny’s car. Amy is now in the back seat.
00:11:35:127000.Speaker: Penny
00:11:35:127000.Dialogue: No, no, I'm just giving you a compliment.

00:11:37:963000.Scene: Penny’s car. Amy is now in the back seat.
00:11:37:963000.Speaker: Amy
00:11:37:963000.Dialogue: Hmm. Would have been more flattered if you were a homosexual.

00:11:44:904000.Scene: Penny’s car. Amy is now in the back seat.
00:11:44:904000.Speaker: Penny

00:11:46:906000.Scene: Penny’s car. Amy is now in the back seat.
00:11:46:906000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:11:46:906000.Dialogue: Oh, no, I wouldn't care for that. Amy?

00:11:49:491000.Scene: Penny’s car. Amy is now in the back seat.
00:11:49:491000.Speaker: Amy

00:11:50:642000.Scene: Penny’s car. Amy is now in the back seat.
00:11:50:642000.Speaker: Penny

00:11:58:117000.Scene: Penny’s car. Amy is now in the back seat.
00:11:58:117000.Speaker: Penny
00:11:58:117000.Dialogue: Hey, Sheldon, have you told Amy what it was like for you growing up in Texas?

00:12:03:839000.Scene: Penny’s car. Amy is now in the back seat.
00:12:03:839000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:12:06:909000.Scene: Penny’s car. Amy is now in the back seat.
00:12:06:909000.Speaker: Penny
00:12:06:909000.Dialogue: Well, why don't you tell her?

00:12:09:328000.Scene: Penny’s car. Amy is now in the back seat.
00:12:09:328000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:12:14:833000.Scene: Penny’s car. Amy is now in the back seat.
00:12:14:833000.Speaker: Penny

00:12:18:604000.Scene: Penny’s car. Amy is now in the back seat.
00:12:18:604000.Speaker: Amy

00:12:24:777000.Scene: Penny’s car. Amy is now in the back seat.
00:12:24:777000.Speaker: Penny
00:12:24:777000.Dialogue: I myself grew up in Nebraska. Small town outside of Omaha. Nice place, mostly family farms, a few meth labs.

00:12:33:786000.Scene: Penny’s car. Amy is now in the back seat.
00:12:33:786000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:12:33:786000.Dialogue: I'm sorry, how is this better than uncomfortable silence?

00:12:37:189000.Scene: Penny’s car. Amy is now in the back seat.
00:12:37:189000.Speaker: Penny
00:12:37:189000.Dialogue: I don't know. I was just trying something.

00:12:49:785000.Speaker: Raj
00:12:49:785000.Dialogue: You slipped and fell into a robot hand?

00:13:05:217000.Speaker: Leonard
00:13:05:217000.Dialogue: I'd suggest a lubricant, but I have a feeling you fell on some of that as well.

00:13:11:607000.Speaker: Raj
00:13:11:607000.Dialogue: Really? A robot hand's got a death grip on your junk, dude. That's funny, ask anyone.

00:13:16:945000.Speaker: Howard
00:13:16:945000.Dialogue: Plea-- before my mother walks in, get this off me!

00:13:21:200000.Speaker: Howard
00:13:21:200000.Dialogue: No, no! Don't touch. The program is paused.

00:13:24:703000.Speaker: Howard
00:13:24:703000.Dialogue: No, no! I loaded the wrong program. The hand thinks it's holding a screwdriver in outer space. If you continue the program, it's gonna start twisting.

00:13:32:261000.Speaker: Raj
00:13:32:261000.Dialogue: A-All right. Um, how about this. When-when Winnie the Pooh got his head stuck in the honey tree, his friends all grabbed onto him and pulled and pulled.

00:13:44:973000.Speaker: Leonard
00:13:44:973000.Dialogue: You do what you want, I'm not touching another man's honey tree.

00:13:49:928000.Speaker: Raj
00:13:49:928000.Dialogue: All right, uh, forget pulling. How about we get an electric saw and cut it off?

00:13:54:199000.Speaker: Howard
00:13:54:199000.Dialogue: What?! No saws! One circumcision was enough.

00:14:03:292000.Speaker: Howard
00:14:03:292000.Dialogue: Okay, I can't believe this needs to be said out loud. No pulling, no saws, no torches.

00:14:07:079000.Speaker: Leonard
00:14:07:079000.Dialogue: Well, then what do you want us to do?

00:14:09:048000.Speaker: Mrs Wolowitz
00:14:09:048000.Dialogue: MRS. WOLOWITZ (yelling): Howard, I made cookies for you and your little friends!

00:14:16:805000.Speaker: Mrs Wolowitz
00:14:16:805000.Dialogue: I'll bring them up with some Hawaiian Punch!

00:14:21:126000.Speaker: Mrs Wolowitz
00:14:21:126000.Dialogue: Why not?! Are you ashamed of your mother?!

00:14:24:229000.Speaker: Howard
00:14:24:229000.Dialogue: Yes, but that's not the point!

00:14:30:635000.Speaker: Raj
00:14:30:635000.Dialogue: Right now, all I can think about is cookies and Hawaiian Punch.

00:14:41:080000.Speaker: Penny
00:14:41:080000.Dialogue: Hey, here's another possible topic of conversation. This is a big night for Sheldon. Right, Sheldon?

00:14:49:071000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:14:49:071000.Dialogue: Big night? The winter solstice is a big night.

00:14:55:194000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:14:55:194000.Dialogue: It's over 14 hours in Southern California.

00:15:03:385000.Speaker: Penny
00:15:03:385000.Dialogue: No, no. My point is, uh, tonight is Sheldon's first official date. Discuss.

00:15:13:178000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:15:13:178000.Dialogue: Apparently, a semi-incestuous Teens for Jesus Fourth of July Hoedown didn't count.

00:15:20:869000.Speaker: Penny
00:15:20:869000.Dialogue: So, um, Amy, what about you? Do you date much?

00:15:23:205000.Speaker: Amy
00:15:23:205000.Dialogue: Once a year. It's a deal I made with my mother in exchange for her silence on the matter, as well as the occasional use of her George Foreman Grill that seals in the flavor without the fat.

00:15:34:933000.Speaker: Amy
00:15:34:933000.Dialogue: How about you, Penny? Do you go on many dates?

00:15:37:219000.Speaker: Penny
00:15:37:219000.Dialogue: Uh, yeah, I wouldn't say many. A few.

00:15:46:562000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:15:46:562000.Dialogue: Your characterization of approximately 171 different men as "a few."

00:15:50:715000.Speaker: Penny
00:15:50:715000.Dialogue: What... Where did you get 171 men?

00:15:55:604000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:15:55:604000.Dialogue: Simple extrapolation. In the three years that I've known you, you were single for two. During that time, I saw 17 different suitors. If we work backwards, correcting for observation bias and postulate an initial dating age of 15...

00:16:08:867000.Speaker: Penny
00:16:08:867000.Dialogue: Whoa, wait, wait, wait. I did not start dating at 15.

00:16:16:124000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:16:16:124000.Dialogue: My mistake. Now, assuming the left side of a bell curve peaking around the present, that would bring the total up to 193 men. Plus or minus eight men.

00:16:29:004000.Speaker: Amy
00:16:29:004000.Dialogue: Remarkable. Did you have sexual intercourse with all of these men?

00:16:34:560000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:16:34:560000.Dialogue: Although that number would be fairly easy to calculate.

00:16:37:613000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:16:37:613000.Dialogue: Based on the number of awkward encounters I've had with strange men leaving her apartment in the morning, plus the number of times she's returned home wearing the same clothes she wore the night before...

00:16:46:271000.Speaker: Penny
00:16:46:271000.Dialogue: Okay, Sheldon, I think you've made your point.

00:16:48:440000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:16:48:440000.Dialogue: So we multiply 193-- minus 21 men before the loss of virginity-- so 172 times 0.18 gives us... 30.96 sexual partners.

00:17:04:223000.Speaker: Penny
00:17:04:223000.Dialogue: Okay, Sheldon, you are so wrong. That is not even close to the real number. I'm gonna need a drink over here.

00:17:11:763000.Speaker: Amy
00:17:11:763000.Dialogue: This is very interesting. Cultural perceptions are subjective. Penny, to your mind, are you a slut?

00:17:18:070000.Speaker: Penny
00:17:18:070000.Dialogue: No! No! No. Let's just all finish our dinners, okay?

00:17:26:695000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:17:26:695000.Dialogue: This is an interesting topic. How many sexual encounters have you had?

00:17:31:149000.Speaker: Amy
00:17:31:149000.Dialogue: Does volunteering for a scientific experiment in which orgasm was achieved by electronically stimulating the pleasure centers of the brain count?

00:18:03:848000.Speaker: Raj
00:18:03:848000.Dialogue: Next time, take your own advice.

00:18:06:485000.Speaker: Leonard
00:18:06:485000.Dialogue: Excuse me, could you help us out?

00:18:08:654000.Speaker: Nurse
00:18:08:654000.Dialogue: My, my, my. What do we have here?

00:18:16:078000.Speaker: Nurse
00:18:16:078000.Dialogue: Yeah, we get that a lot. What is this?

00:18:22:884000.Speaker: Nurse
00:18:22:884000.Dialogue: Where's the rest of the robot?

00:18:27:506000.Speaker: Nurse
00:18:27:506000.Dialogue: Cause that's all you needed, right?

00:18:31:843000.Speaker: Howard
00:18:31:843000.Dialogue: Can you please just help me?!

00:18:34:229000.Speaker: Nurse
00:18:34:229000.Dialogue: All right, all right. Hang on, stay calm. (over P.A.): I need an orderly with a wheelchair. I got a robot hand grasping a man's penis out here.

00:18:46:241000.Speaker: Howard
00:18:46:241000.Dialogue: You think you could be a little more discreet?

00:18:48:443000.Speaker: Nurse
00:18:48:443000.Dialogue: I'm sorry, we don't have a code for robot hand grasping a man's penis.

00:18:53:248000.Speaker: Nurse
00:18:53:248000.Dialogue: Why is it hooked up to a computer?

00:18:55:066000.Speaker: Leonard
00:18:55:066000.Dialogue: Uh, it's what controls the arm.

00:18:57:619000.Speaker: Nurse
00:18:57:619000.Dialogue: Did you try turning it off and back on again?

00:19:00:422000.Speaker: Howard
00:19:00:422000.Dialogue: No, you see, it's more complicated than that. No, wait!

00:19:11:750000.Speaker: Howard
00:19:11:750000.Dialogue: Winnie the Pooh is out of the honey tree.

00:19:15:303000.Speaker: Raj
00:19:15:303000.Dialogue: Now can we have cookies and Hawaiian Punch?

00:19:25:306000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:19:25:306000.Dialogue: You were right. This was a very productive evening. I saw a whole new side of Amy Farrah Fowler tonight.

00:19:33:447000.Speaker: Penny
00:19:33:447000.Dialogue: I did not have sex with 31 guys.

00:19:37:318000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:19:37:318000.Dialogue: I'll be happy to check the math, but numbers don't lie, Penny. In any event, now that Amy and I have spent quality time together, I feel much more confident proceeding to the next stage of our relationship.

00:19:52:166000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:19:52:166000.Dialogue: Using in vitro fertilization and a surrogate uterus to gift humanity with our progeny.

00:20:00:925000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:20:00:925000.Dialogue: In these uncertain times,  doesn't humanity deserve a gift?

00:20:05:846000.Speaker: Penny
00:20:05:846000.Dialogue: (sighs) Okay, you know what? I'm gonna come at this in a whole new way. Sheldon, if you try to make a baby with Amy in a petri dish, I'm gonna tell your mother on you.

00:20:15:823000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:20:15:823000.Dialogue: That's no threat. My mother's always wanted a grandchild.

00:20:19:743000.Speaker: Penny
00:20:19:743000.Dialogue: Really? Your deeply religious born-again Christian mother wants a test-tube grandbaby born out of wedlock?

00:20:31:088000.Speaker: Penny
00:20:31:088000.Dialogue: If I'd thought of that in the first place, I could've saved myself this whole night.

00:20:35:259000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:20:35:259000.Dialogue: Well, it's not that late. You could still go out and look for number 32.

00:20:50:257000.Speaker: Leonard
00:20:50:257000.Dialogue: Yeah, yeah, great. Howard, uh, slow down. What do you mean it happened again?
